ZE1jlpmA.title: Assessment and Influencing Factors Analysis on Quality of Life among Baoshan Residents in Shanghai
ZE1jlpmA.abstract: Objective To understand the current status on the Quality of Life (QOL) and to analyze the influence factors to supply evidence for health education and health promotion. Methods There were 858 residents involved a face-to-face interview according to the WHOQOL-BREF questionnaire. The multiple linear logistic regression analysis was used to analyze the influence factors related to QOL. Results The evaluations of QOL of the residents in Baoshan, which including embody physical and psychological, social relationships and environment as its target items, scored 15.53±1.96, 15.55±1.82, 15.48±2.01 and 14.37±1.94 respectively, surpassing the average levels of the counterparts both in home and other 23 countries in the world (P<0.01) other than in the item of physical fitness. And the general scores of life quality and health condition amounted to 3.63±0.66 and 3.56±0.71 respectively. The logistic analysis demonstrated that the main influence factors on QOL were living condition, age, physical and mental fitness, sports exercises, family income and employment situation, and the living condition and physical exercises, compared with the others, exerted the most sweeping impacts on QOL. Conclusion According to the survey, the overall state of QOL of the residents in Baoshan is relatively sound. We should strive for the further improvements of residents QOL, advocating physical exercises, caring for the elder groups, optimizing community services, enhancing people's physical and mental health, so as to make a boost to the well-being of the whole society at large.

MoRq6tvp.title: Analysis of Causes for Community Residents' Lack of Health Communication Channels Contact
MoRq6tvp.abstract: OBJECTIVE To analyze the causes for community residents' lack of health communication channels contact, to provide basis for carrying out community health communication scientifically. METHODS By using the random sampling, 1 275 residents among 16 to 69 years old were selected to be investigated about lack of health communication channels contact status and causes. RESULTS The top five health communication channels which were lack of contact due to constraints or residents don't know were health magazine(84.4%),newspaper(78.4%), self management(75.1%), telephone counseling(70.1%) and book(68.7%), the last three were board(17.7%), publicity column(11.9%) and health TV program(2.0%). The top five health communication channels which were lack of contact among people in conditional access were telephone counseling(86.1%), self management(71.6%), community counseling(42.5%), health lecture(38.1%)and publicity activity(37.7%). The health communication channels which were lack of contact due to do not like mainly were health TV program, mobile TV, message, lecture, publicity activity and self management; those which were lack of contact due to hasn't enough time were health radio, publicity column and board; those were lack of contact due to has no demand were community counseling, telephone counseling and net information. CONCLUSION Subjective factors are influenced by lack of health communication channels contact, publicity should be strengthened, guide demanded, conditions are created to convenient residents use health communication channels for information.

1I3KBHVA.title: Effectiveness Evaluation of Health Education on Reasonable Nutrition among Community Residents in Baoshan District,Shanghai
1I3KBHVA.abstract: Objective To evaluate the intervention effect of reasonable nutrition among community residents so as to further provide a reasonable basis for nutrition interventions.Methods Two groups of community residents were selected as the intervention group,and implemented a 15-month comprehensive intervention.Evaluation was carried out on community residents' knowledge,attitude,belief of both intervene and antitheses before and after the intervention.Results Compared to the community residents of antitheses,the knowledge has a remarkable advancement(P<0.05) for the residents who were intervened.Because of these things the habits for dietetic and cuisine have also improved significantly(P<0.05).Except several residents,these for the residents of antitheses almost remain the same.Conclusion Health education of a reasonable nutrition among community residents will contribute to the improvement of the community residents' nutritional reasonable KAP level.

ywLjj3LS.title: Investigation about Residents' Mental Health in Baoshan District of Shanghai
ywLjj3LS.abstract: Objectives To investigate the awareness and services demands for mental health among residents in Baoshan District,Shanghai and to provide basis for further planning and interventions.Methods By using multi-stage stratified sampling method,totally 220 people of permanent residence or non-household were selected and surveyed.Results For the definition of abnormal mental behavior,90.9% of the people selected sadness and the attempt to suicide attempts.For definition of healthy mental behavior,90.5% selected good social relationships.Differences of choices in different education and age groups were larger than that of different gender.71.8% of the people's first choice of psychological needs was counseling agencies,90.5% received comfort and help from friends,30.4% participated in community group activities frequently.177 thought they were able to fully respond to distress,rating for 80.5%.In the last week,166 people's motional feelings were mild,178 were positive,making up 75.5% and 80.9% respectively.The age,occupation,satisfaction about life could influence the intensity and positive degree of emotion.Conclusions The awareness and services demand of mental health among residents in Baoshan District was scientific and rational,experience of emotion and stress was stable.Neighborhood communication should be strengthened.

wZE15hdV.title: Analysis of the Surveillance upon Residents' Knowledge and Attitudes to STD/AIDS in Baoshan District during 2004 to 2007
wZE15hdV.abstract: Objective To objectively analyze the general situation of residents in Baoshan district upon their knowledge on sexually transmitted diseases (STD)/AIDS and attitudes towards HIV-infectious patients. This work aims to serve as an evidence for further studies on community healthcare education. Methods Based on the previous surveillance data of behavior risk factors collected during the periods from 2004 to 2007,we analyze the (STD)/AIDS-related knowledge,attitude changes and the influencing factors among the residents in Baoshan district. Results There has been an increase from 27.5% to 36.0% (P<0.05) in the rates of correct knowledge of AIDS transmitting routes in the past four years,while an reduction from 54.2% to 46.7% (P<0.05) on the correct knowledge of STD transmission. Substantial variations were observed among regions,ages,sex,education levels and occupations. Positive responses have been derived in terms of the residents’ use of contraception condom to against AIDS (P<0.05). And a proportionally increasing number of people have shown their supports for the immediate treatments to STD/AIDS-infectious patients (P<0.05). Conclusions The former education on AIDS has already achieved evident accomplishments. The healthcare providers should continue to work hard to educate people of diseases prevention thoroughly and scientifically.

NjgZBMge.title: Analysis on the Prevalence and Relative Factors of Overweight and Obseity in Baoshan District,Shanghai
NjgZBMge.abstract: Objective To explore the current status and relative factors associated with overweight and obesity among residents in Baoshan District. Methods A questionnaire survey based on the Behavior Risk Factor Surveillance Method was conducted about relative factors associated with overweight and obesity. Results The overweight rate and the obesity rate amount to 31.6% and 7.0% respectively. The rate of overweight of men is higher than that of women (P<0.01), while the rate of obesity gets the other way round (P<0.01). The overweight rate and the obesity rate both increase with the rise of age (P<0.01) and decrease with the elevation of education level (P<0.01). And the obesity rate declines with the rise of household income (P<0.05), which doesn’t exert an apparent impact on overweight. In the aspect of occupations, the rate of obesity is the lowest among workers, the highest among retirees (P<0.01). The results based on analysis of Logistic show that major factors that have given rise to overweight include age, gender, mental job and eating excessive desserts. Factors of gender, age, monthly income may contribute to obesity. Conclusion As the result of survey carried in Baoshan district isn’t so optimistic, more importance should be attached to promoting people’s awareness of knowledge towards overweight and obesity. It is of necessity to further the work of health education and promotion.

PMWfJqC6.title: A Study on the Application of Metacognitive Strategy in the Cultivation of Intercultural Communicative Competence
PMWfJqC6.abstract: Metacognitive strategy has proven to play a very important role in English learning; however,it has rarely been used in the cultivation of college students’ intercultural communicative competence. Based on the theory of metacognitive strategy,this article tries to integrate them into the cultivation of intercultural communicative competence from the four phases of warming-up,planning,monitoring and evaluating in the process of the teaching and leaning of intercultural communication. Effective improvement of students’ intercultural communicative competence is expected to be achieved through the enhancement of their metacognition and autonomous learning capacity.

0Ip2zAzh.title: Primary application of whole-brain CT perfusion imaging in patients with transient ischemic attack
0Ip2zAzh.abstract: Objective To explore the value of whole-brain CT perfusion(CTP) imaging in patients with transient ischemic attack(TIA).Methods Whole-brain CTP was performed in 40 patients with clinically diagnosed TIA.The parameter maps of time to peak(TTP),mean transit time(MTT),cerebral blood flow(CBF),and cerebral blood volume(CBV) were analyzed.Dynamic CT angiography(4D-CTA) images were also obtained.Results Fifty-eight areas of abnormal perfusion changes corresponding to clinical symptoms were found in 36 of the 40 patients with CTP.Prolonged TTP and MTT,decreased CBF and increased or non-changed CBV were detected in the abnormal perfusion areas.The differences of TTP,MTT and CBF of the affected side compared with those of the contralateral side were significant(P<0.05),but the difference of CBV was not(P>0.05).4D-CTA showed responsible vascular stenosis or occlusion in varying degrees.In the 40 patients,vascular stenosis was found in 32 patients,occlusion in 2 patients and normal in 6 patients.Conclusion Overall assessment of TIA can be achieved by whole-brain CTP imaging,which has a great value for the diagnosis and evaluation of TIA.

I30kThny.title: Application of diffusion weighted imaging in diagnosis and following-up of cerebral venous infarction
I30kThny.abstract: Objective To explore the value of diffusion weighted imaging(DWI) in the diagnosis and following-up of cerebral venous infarction(CVI).Methods Fifteen patients with clinically or radiologically proved CVI underwent conventional MRI,contrast enhanced magnetic resonance venography(CE-MRV) and DWI before and after treatment.The DWI findings and changes during following-up were analyzed.Results Twenty-six lesions were detected in 15 patients with conventional MRI and DWI.DWI showed hyperintensity(8 lesions),mild hyerintensity(13 lesions),mixed intensity(3 lesions) and isointensity(2 lesions) before treatment,while hyperintensity(2 lesions),slightly hyerintensity(6 lesions),mixed intensity(4 lesions) and isointensity(14 lesions) after treatment.The difference of signal intensity on DWI had statistical significance(P<0.05) before and after treatment.The ADC values were(5.09±2.04)×10-4 mm2/s before treatment and(6.25±0.76)×10-4 mm2/s after treatment(t=-2.72,P<0.05).Conclusion DWI can demonstrate CVI early,define the type of edema,therefore has important clinical value in the diagnosis and following-up of CVI combined with conventional MRI and CE-MRV.

JJG7r7YS.title: Application of whole-brain CT perfusion imaging with 320-detector row CT in acute ischemic cerebrovascular diseases
JJG7r7YS.abstract: Objective: To explore the application of whole-brain CT perfusion (CTP) imaging with 320-detector row CT in patients with acute ischemic cerebrovascular diseases (AICVD). Methods: Twenty patients diagnosed as AICVD underwent plain CT and CTP within 24 h after the onset of symptoms. The parameter maps of cerebral blood flow (CBF), cerebral blood volume (CBV), mean transit time (MTT)and time to peak (TTP) were analyzed. Meanwhile dynamic CT angiography (4D-CTA) images were obtained. MR was performed within 24 h after CTP. Results: Early infarctions were found in 8 patients, and 12 patients showed normal on conventional plain CT, while 32 ischemic lesions corresponding to clinical symptoms were found in whole-brain CTP. MRI confirmed that 26 lesions were infarct foci. And 4D-CTA showed vascular stenosis in 14 patients, occlusion in 2 patients, and normal in 4 patients. Conclusion: Full evaluation of AICVD can be achieved using whole-brain CT perfusion imaging with 320-detector row CT.

Fm6mRBjF.title: Characteristic of Classic on Medical Problems Annotated by Hua Shou
Fm6mRBjF.abstract: Genuine Meaning of the Classic on Medical Problems was a classic commentary book on Classic on Medical Problems.Inheriting the previous spirits of ZHANG Zhong-jing,WANG Shu-he and the theory of approximately twenty doctors in the Tang,Song,Jin and Yuan Dynasty and combining with his own opinion.HUA Shou comprehensively annotated Classic on Medical Problems.In this paper,the commentary book of HUA Shou was expounded from three aspects:format,contents and characteristic.The characteristic of it was summarized from three aspects:esteeming Yellow Emperor's Internal Classic and expounding classic with another one,hinting each other and digesting well;listing different standpoints of doctors and explaining their own opinion directly.

QLoeVFM8.title: The Discussion of Teaching of International Classification of Diseases
QLoeVFM8.abstract: The teaching of International Classification of Diseases can’t achieve the teaching goal in China now.The specialized teachers and the subject matter experts should work together to improve the level.We adopt student assessment and social employer assessment to supervise the teaching.Provide more plentiful and practical content of courses to make enough technical guidance.At the same time,using various teaching methods,such as case-based teaching and PBL teaching.This paper proposed a series of suggestions,combine with the characteristics of the ICD teaching and the technical difficulties during the operation of classification of diseases.

pGEh6Mey.title: Textual research of doctors cited by The Pulse Classic
pGEh6Mey.abstract: The Pulse Classic was written by Shuhe-wang in Wei dynasty.Although the points of medical view of eight famous doctors—wang,ruan,fu,dai,wu,ge,lv,zhang were different,they were all adopted in the Pulse Classic according to the author's preface of the Pulse Classic.This article performed a carefully textual research of these eight famous doctors—wang,ruan,fu,dai,wu,ge,lv,zhang on basis of title catalogues of the past books combined with correlating historic materials.The importance of the research was expected to have a benefit on the Pulse Classic forming and the study of history of TCM.

qq4oWasd.title: Clinical Observation of Combined Treatment of Traditional Chinese Medicine and Western Medicine to Severe Acute Pancreatitis
qq4oWasd.abstract: Objective To observe the therapeutic effect of combined treatment of traditional Chinese medicine and western medicine on severe acute pancreatitis.Methods 52 cases of acute pancreatitis patient were randomly divided into two groups,28 cases of control group were treated with conventional western medicine while 24 cases of therapic group were treated by combined treatment of traditional Chinese medicine and western medicine.Results The symptoms of abdominal distention in therapeutic group were obviously abated and recovered earlier than that in control group.The cure rate increased markedly while the complications,transferring operability and the mortality rate all decreased significantly in therapeutic group.Conclusion Therapeutic efficacy which was treated by the combined treatment of traditional Chinese medicine and western medicine is more effective than that of conventional western medicine.
keywords: Combined treatment of traditional Chinese medicine and western medicine

RQdEy1eh.title: Dissection of the role of paeoniflorin in the traditional Chinese medicinal formula Si-Ni-San against contact dermatitis in mice.
RQdEy1eh.abstract: The roles of specific active ingredients in Chinese medicinal formulas have not been clearly elucidated. In this study, we selectively deleted and replenished paeoniflorin from Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, and aimed to identify the molecular basis of how paeoniflorin exerted its effect in Si-Ni-San.Contact dermatitis was induced in mice with picryl chloride. Paeoniflorin was selectively deleted from Si-Ni-San by an immunoaffinity column. Quantitative real-time PCR, western blot, and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay were used in this study.Both Si-Ni-San and paeoniflorin significantly reduced ear swelling in mice while the paeoniflorin-deleted Si-Ni-San (Si-Ni-San(PF-)) showed little ameliorative effect. In lipopolysaccharide-evoked macrophages, Si-Ni-San and paeoniflorin markedly inhibited tumor necrosis factor-alpha production, cyclooxygenase-2 activity, as well as extracellular signal-regulated kinase 1/2 phosphorylation while Si-Ni-San(PF-) exhibited no or slight inhibitory effect. Furthermore, the inhibitory effect on the production of tumor necrosis factor-alpha reappeared when different proportions of paeoniflorin were replenished in Si-Ni-San(PF-). In addition, the expression of macrophage migration inhibitory factor in T cells, rather than macrophages, was significantly inhibited by Si-Ni-San, but not Si-Ni-San(PF-). Our data indicate paeoniflorin is the principal component of Si-Ni-San, exerting negative regulation on the function of macrophages in contact dermatitis.The present study suggests that dissecting the role of specific constituents in medicinal formulas through selective deletion and replenishment may be a useful strategy in recognizing and validating an active ingredient in traditional Chinese medicine.
keywords: traditional chinese medicine si-ni-san paeoniflorin selective deletion immunoaffinity column

9fT7dcF6.title: SELECTION OF Procambarus clarkiiSUB-ADULT AND JUVENILE OF DIFFERENT AMMONIA CONCENTRATION
9fT7dcF6.abstract: This experiment used NH4Cl for the main constituent to prepare ammonia solutions and a Y shape water maze for experiment equipment.Our purpose was to find out the selection of Procambarus clarkii of different ammonia concentration from the ethological point of view.Five concentrations of 4.750,7.125,9.500,14.250 and 19.000 mg/L were set.Their pH value was 7.0,the temperature was 20±0.5℃.P.clarkii sub-adult of 5.01±0.43 cm in body length and juvenile of 0.75±0.15 cm in body length were used for the experiment.Ammonia solution and clean water were put in the 2 selection areas of a Y shape water maze,then let the crayfish choose,the times of selection of ammonia solution,clean water and no selection were recorded.Binomial test of nonparametric tests to calculate the data was carried out.The result indicated that the sub-adults had no selection at the ammonia concentration of 4.750,7.125,9.500 and 14.250 mg/L,but they significantly avoided the ammonia solution with concentration of 19.000 mg/L;the juveniles had no selection at the ammonia concentration of 4.750 mg/L,but they significantly avoided the ammonia solution when the ammonia concentration is 7.125 and 9.500 mg/L,and they had toxic symptom and lost the ability of selection when the ammonia concentration is 14.250 and 19.000 mg/L.The study indicated that P.clarkii has no preference for ammonia solution and will avoid the ammonia solution when the concentration reaches the right value or even die when they can't avoid in time.

OtD1cXL6.title: Anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effect of flavones isolated from Artemisia vestita.
OtD1cXL6.abstract: Artemisia vestita is a common traditional Tibetan medicinal plant which has been used widely in China for treating various inflammatory diseases. Since little is known about its active components, the purpose of this study was to isolate and identify the immunosuppressive compounds from Artemisia vestita.A bioassay-guided isolation was performed with picryl chloride-induced contact hypersensitivity in mice. MTT assay and Flow cytometric analysis were used for determining Con A-induced lymphocyte proliferation and CD25 expression in T cells, respectively.The ethanol extract of the Artemisia vestita was found to possess significant inhibitory activity against the picryl chloride-induced contact hypersensitivity in mice. Then 4 fractions were isolated by macroporous adsorption resin and one of these fractions (AV3), which showed the highest activity in in vivo test, was further subjected to column chromatography. Nine known flavones were isolated and identified as pectolinarigenin (1), jaceosidin (2), cirsilineol (3), cirsimaritin (4), hispidulin (5), quercetin (6), 6-methoxytricin (7), acacetin (8), and apigenin (9). The structures of the 9 flavones were elucidated by spectral techniques. All the compounds were evaluated for their inhibitory activity on the proliferation and activation of T cells in vitro. Among the 9 flavones, cirsilineol (3), 6-methoxytricin (7) and apigenin (9) significantly inhibited T cell proliferation and activation in the bioassays.The result suggests that cirsilineol, 6-methoxytricin and apigenin are the major active components in Artemisia vestita.

Ljrjbc3j.title: Ethanol extract from Artemisia vestita, a traditional Tibetan medicine, exerts anti-sepsis action through down-regulating the MAPK and NF-κB pathways
Ljrjbc3j.abstract: Artemisia vestita Wall., a traditional Tibetan medicine, has wide clinical application for inflammatory diseases. However, its molecular mechanism of anti-inflammatory effect is poorly understood. In the present study, we investigated the anti-inflammatory activity and underlying mechanism of the ethanol extract from Artemisia vestita (AV-ext) on lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-induced sepsis. Pretreatment with AV-ext significantly decreased the levels of tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-alpha) in serum and liver and lung tissues, and improved the survival of mice with experimental sepsis. AV-ext also remarkably reduced the expression levels of TNF-alpha, interleukin-1beta and cyclooxygenase-2 in LPS-stimulated RAW 264.7 macrophages and dose dependently suppressed the activation of mitogen-activated protein kinases (MAPKs), such as p38, extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK1/2) and c-Jun NH2-terminal kinase (JNK). Furthermore, pretreatment with AV-ext dose dependently inhibited the activation of nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB), as well as the degradation and phosphorylation of inhibitory kappaB (IkappaB) in LPS-activated RAW 264.7 macrophages. These results collectively reveal that AV-ext inhibits TNF-alpha release from macrophages by suppressing MAPK and NF-kappaB signaling pathways and suggest that AV-ext may be beneficial for the treatment of endotoxin shock or sepsis.

ikzC085j.title: Simultaneous quantification of five major bioactive flavonoids in Rhizoma smilacis glabrae by high-performance liquid chromatography.
ikzC085j.abstract: A high-performance liquid chromatographic (HPLC) method was developed for the simultaneous determination of five flavonoids, taxifolin, neoastilbin, astilbin, neoisoastilbin and isoastilbin, contained in rhizoma smilacis glabrae. The optimal conditions of separation and detection were achieved on a Lichrospher C18 column (250 mm x 4.6 mm, 5 microm), with a gradient elution program, detected at 291 nm. The correlation coefficients of all the calibration curves showed good linearity (r>0.999) within test ranges. The relative deviation of this method was less than 3% for intra- and inter-day assays, and the average recoveries (n=3) were between 96.2 and 103.1%. The extraction process was also optimized as 2 h immersion and 30 min sonication in 60% ethanol. Eight samples of rhizoma smilacis glabrae from different locations in China were analyzed. The results indicate that the assay is reproducible and precise and could be readily utilized for the quality control of rhizoma smilacis glabrae.

eh0LBBsZ.title: Identification of a new metabolite of astilbin, 3'-O-methylastilbin, and its immunosuppressive activity against contact dermatitis.
eh0LBBsZ.abstract: Astilbin is a flavonoid isolated from the rhizome of Smilax glabra. In a previous study, we revealed its unique immunosuppressive activity, a selective inhibition against activated T lymphocytes. This characteristic of astilbin is beneficial for the treatment of human immune diseases.We incubated astilbin with rat liver microsomal/cytosolic fractions and isolated the metabolite of astilbin, which was fully characterized by mass spectrometry (MS) and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy. We administered astilbin orally via a gastric tube to rats at 0.22 mmol/kg and collected whole blood samples after 30 min and urine samples after 0 to 12 h. We applied HPLC and liquid chromatography/MS to measure the metabolite in the samples, and we assayed cytokine expression by reverse-transcription PCR.After incubation of astilbin with rat liver microsomal/cytosolic fractions, we detected a new metabolite of astilbin and isolated it from the culture solution. We characterized this metabolite by MS and NMR techniques as 3'-O-methylated astilbin. We detected the metabolite in both blood and urine samples after oral administration of astilbin, and the metabolite inhibited picryl chloride-induced ear swelling in mice and suppressed the expression of tumor necrosis factor-alpha and interferon-gamma, similarly to astilbin.This is the first identification of 3'-O-methylastilbin as a new flavonoid, as well as an active metabolite of astilbin in vivo, and is helpful for studying the kinetics of astilbin and its clinical applications.

7SRWH2o1.title: The Interspecies Competition between Red Swamp Crayfish Procambarus clarkii and Chinese Matten Handed Crab Eriocheir sinensis in Three Different Habitats
7SRWH2o1.abstract: Red swamp crayfish Procambarus clarkii and Chinese matten handed crab Eriocheir sinensis were maintained together in two type ponds,one with burrows or corners and the other without any shelters,to study the interspecies competition via the harvests and recapture in monoculture and polyculture under natural conditions.The results showed that there were significantly higher survival and lower disability in the red swamp crayfish in the polyculture ponds with burrows and without any shelters.However,the Chinese matten handed crab had significantly lower survival and higher disability in the polyculture ponds with burrows.In the polyculture ponds with corners,however,the red swamp crayfish showed significantly lower survival rate,without significant differences in survival of the Chinese matten handed crab rate.There were no significant differences in the harvests of red swamp crayfish in the monoculture and polyculture under natural conditions.

hM0PQo7m.title: Specific depletion of naringin from Si-Ni-San, a traditional chinese prescription, by an immunoaffinity chromatography
hM0PQo7m.abstract: To specifically deplete the compound naringin from Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, an immunoafflnity chromatography column was prepared. The naringin bovine serum albumin (BSA) complex (naringin-BSA) was synthesized to make the complete antigen naringin-BSA. Polyclonal antibody was prepared from the serum of rabbit immunized with naringin-BSA. Then, an immunoaffinity column was made by covalently coupling the polyclonal antibody to CNBr-activated Sepharose 4B and used for depleting naringin from Si-Ni-San. The polyclonal antibody obtained from the rabbit serum was found through enzyme linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) to show the titer of 1: 30 000, the purity of 94% and low cross-reaction rate. The coupling rate of the polyclonal antibody to Sepharose 4B was 87%. By using this column, naringin in Si-Ni-San was selectively depleted from the whole extract. This immunoafflnity column of anti-naringin antibody could be used for specifically depleting naringin from SiNi-San and other samples.

Z1gLXaQG.title: Determination of Quercitrin in the Leaves of Lindera aggregata(Sims) Kosterm.by HPLC
Z1gLXaQG.abstract: Objective To establish a method for the determination of quercitrin in the leaves of Lindera aggregata(Sims) Kosterm.Methods The chromatographic determination of quercitrin was performed on Shimpack VP-ODS column(150 mm× 4.6 mm,4.6 μ m).The mobile phase consisted of acetonitrile-0.5 % glacial acetic acid aqueous solution with a flow rate of 1 mL· min-1.The detection wavelength was monitored at 254 nm,and the column oven was maintained at 40 ℃.Results The calibration curves of quercitrin were linear in the range of 1～ 100 μ g· mL-1(r=0.999 9).The average recovery of quercitrin was 98.38 %(RSD=1.85 %),and the properties of sample solution kept steady within 24 hours.Conclusion This method is accurate,rapid,and simple,and has a good linear relationship.

etf8V6qs.title: Selective depletion of glycyrrhizin from Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, blocks its effect on contact sensitivity in mice and recovers adhesion and metalloproteinases production of T lymphocytes.
etf8V6qs.abstract: In the present study, we performed to selectively deplete glycyrrhizin from Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription that consists of 4 Chinese herbs including Radix Glycyrrhizae Uralensis, and examined its influence on the suppressing activity of Si-Ni-San against contact sensitivity in mice. An immunoaffinity column was made by covalently coupling the polyclonal antibody, obtained by the immunization with glycyrrhizin-BSA conjugate, to CNBr-activated Sepharose 4B. By using this column, glycyrrhizin in Si-Ni-San was selectively and almost completely depleted from the whole extract, which was confirmed by high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC). Both 200 mg/kg of Si-Ni-San and 10 mg/kg of glycyrrhizin, the dose corresponding to its proportion contained in Si-Ni-San, significantly reduced the ear swelling of picryl chloride (PCl)-induced ear contact sensitivity in mice and the inhibition by Si-Ni-San was stronger than that by glycyrrhizin. The adhesion activity to type IV collagen of the isolated spleen cells from PCl-sensitized mice was significantly decreased by both Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin. However, the glycyrrhizin-depleted sample of Si-Ni-San (Si-Ni-San(GL-)) only showed a slight inhibition on the cell adhesion. Furthermore, the spleen cells from PCl-sensitized mice produced more matrix metalloproteinase (MMP)-2 and -9 than naive spleen cells did, and both Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin remarkably reduced MMP-2 and MMP-9 production. In contrast, Si-Ni-San(GL-) only showed a slight inhibition. These results suggest that glycyrrhizin may act as one of the active constituents of Si-Ni-San in inhibiting delayed-type hypersensitivity reaction via down-regulating the MMP production and the cell adhesion to extracellular matrix. The present study also provides a new approach to recognize and validate an active constituent in traditional prescription through a selective depletion.

p1d8dEvd.title: Cirsilineol inhibits proliferation of cancer cells by inducing apoptosis via mitochondrial pathway.
p1d8dEvd.abstract: Cirsilineol (4',5-dihydroxy-3',6,7-trimethoxyflavone) is a compound isolated from the herb of Artemisia vestita Wall (Compositae). In this study, we aimed at examining the anti-proliferative activity of cirsilineol against multiple types of cancer cells and the underlying mechanisms. Cirsilineol significantly inhibited proliferation of Caov-3, Skov-3, PC3 and Hela cells in a concentration-dependent manner. The compound also dose-dependently induced apoptosis in Caov-3 cells, as determined by annexin V/propidium iodide staining. Besides, cirsilineol induced a remarkable change in mitochondrial membrane potential and caused release of cytochrome c to cytosol. Furthermore, the compound caused a marked activation of capase-3, caspase-9 and poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP). These results suggested that the induction of apoptosis via the mitochondrial pathway was involved in the anti-proliferative activity of cirsilineol against cancer cells.
p1d8dEvd.venue: The Journal of pharmacy and pharmacology

DKCRHYDA.title: Role of four major components in the effect of Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, against contact sensitivity in mice.
DKCRHYDA.abstract: Previously, we demonstrated the inhibitory effects of Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, on picryl chloride-induced ear contact sensitivity (PCl-CS). This study aimed to evaluate the role of the four major constituents contained in the prescription (saikosaponins, paeoniflorin, naringin and glycyrrhizin) in the inhibitory effect. When administered during the induction phase, saikosaponin a and glycyrrhizin showed significant inhibitory effects, while paeoniflorin and naringin did not. These components in Si-Ni-San also inhibited the activation and proliferation of T lymphocytes as well as the production of cytokines such as tumour necrosis factor-alpha and interferon-gamma to different extents. Saikosaponin a and paeoniflorin dose-dependently reduced the splenocyte adhesion to type I collagen, while glycyrrhizin only showed a slight tendency. Furthermore, treatment with glycyrrhizin or saikosaponin a, rather than paeoniflorin or naringin, moderately inhibited the matrix metalloproteinase (MMP)-2 activity of the splenocytes from PCl-CS mice, and the combination of all four components showed a strong inhibition against MMP-2. Moreover, the components markedly decreased the serum level of nitric oxide in PCl-sensitized mice. The results indicated that saikosaponin a and glycyrrhizin may be the major contributors in the alleviation effect of Si-Ni-San on contact sensitivity, and paeoniflorin and naringin may exhibit a co-operative effect.
DKCRHYDA.venue: The Journal of pharmacy and pharmacology

ePKU5N3C.title: Studies on Total Flavonoids Extracted from Peanut Hull and Its Hydroxyl Radical Scavenging Effects
ePKU5N3C.abstract: Objective:To study the extraction technology of total flavonoids from peanut hull and its antioxidizable activity.Methods:Concentration of extracting solution,solid-liquid ratio,temperature and time of extraction were investigated through orthogonal tests of L9(34).In addition,D101 macroporous resin was used to enrich flavonoids and its scavenging of hydroxyl radicals by Fenton was also studied in the paper.Results:The optimum conditions of extracting flavonoids from peanut hull were:ethanol concentration 70%,solid-liquid ratio 1:2(0m:V),extraction duration 2 h and refluxing temperature 80 ℃,respectively;D-101 macroporous adsorption resins can separate and purify flavonoids from peanut hull and flavanones from peanut hull had effects on scavenging of hydroxyl radicals.Conclusion:The study provides an experimental basis for the comprehensive utilization of active ingredient in peanut hull.

U7Lx1UJ9.title: Anti-oxidative and Hepatoprotective Activities of the Total Flavonoids from the Leaf of Lindera aggregata (Sims) Kosterm.Against Mice Liver Injury Induced by Carbon Tetrachloride
U7Lx1UJ9.abstract: Objective To explore the anti-oxidation effect and mechanism of the total flavones from the leaf of Lindera aggregata (LA-flavonoids). Methods The total antioxidation and anti-superoxide anion capacities were measured to evaluate the anti-oxidation activity of LA-flavonoids in the chemical model system in vitro. Acute liver injury mice model was induced with carbon tetrachloride (CCl4),and the effect of LA-flavonoids on serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels as well as the contents of malondialdehyde (MDA),superoxide dismutase (SOD) and total anti-oxidation capacity were examined. RT-PCR was used for the determination of oxidation-related genes expression in liver tissues of mice with liver injury. Results In the chemical model system in vitro,with the increase of LA-flavonoids concentration,the total anti-oxidation and anti-superoxide anion capacities were increased. In mice with CCl4-induced acute liver injury,LA-flavonoids at the concentrations of 50～200 mg/kg significantly decreased the ALT and AST activities and MDA content,and increased the activities of SOD and total antioxidation capacity in serum. The mRNA expression of thioredoxin,heme oxygenase-1 and peroxiredoxin-1 in liver tissues were also increased by LA-flavonoids. Conclusion LA-flavonoids has protective effect against CCl4-induced acute liver injury by clearing away free radicals and inhibiting lipid peroxidation. Its antioxidant activity may be related to the regulation of some antioxidant-related genes.

1EzpSUJn.title: Inhibition of Proliferation and Activation of Spleen cells of Mice by Ethanol Extract from Artemisia Vestita
1EzpSUJn.abstract: Objective To examine the inhibitory effect of 75% ethanol extract from aerial parts of Artemisia vestita,a traditional Tibetan medicine, on the proliferation and activation of mouse spleen cells activated with concanavalin A (Con A). Method To activate spleen cells of mice with Con A in vitro and then observe the effect of the ethanol extract on the proliferation and activation of the cells by the method of MTT, CFSE and flow cytometric analysis. Results The ethanol extract from Artemisia vestita can remarkably inhibit the proliferation and activation of spleen cells activated by Con in vitro and its effect depends on dosages. Conclusion The ethanol extract from Artemisia vestita is able to exert inhibitory effect on the proliferation and activation of spleen cells activated by Con A, implying that this traditional Tibetan medicine has an immunosuppressive activity?

a0CLkUNo.title: Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay for the determination of paeoniflorin in plasma
a0CLkUNo.abstract: A method was developed for the determination of paeoniflorin in plasma by competitive enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). The artifical antigen was used as immunogen and applied in New Zealand rabbits to get the anti-paeoniflorin antibodies. Hapten coupled with OVA was used as coating antigen. The linear concentrations ranged from 10 μg/L to 200 mu;g/L and the calibration curve was Y = -0.1721 logC + 1.9645. Recoveries for the standard addition paeoniflorin to blank palsma were 89%-102%. The method has been successfully applied to determine the concentration of paeoniflorin in rat plasma. After an oral administration of the Si-Ni-San decoction, the bioavailability of paeoniflorin was lower than a single dose of paeoniflorin.

m9SL0EFW.title: Determation of Astilbin contained in the leaf of Engelhardia roxburghiana Wall by HPLC
m9SL0EFW.abstract: OBJECTIVE To establish a RP-HPLC method for determination of astilbin contained in the leaf of Engelhardia roxburghiana Wall.METHODS The chromatographic conditions were as follows: Column: Lichrospher C-18(4.6 mm × 250 mm,5 μm).Mobile phase: methanol-0.3% acetic acid(v/v,45∶55).Wave length: 291 nm.Flow rate: 1.0 mL·min~(-1).Column temperature: 25℃. RESULTS The calibration curves were linear in range of 0.182～1.093 μg for astilbin(r=0.9995,n=6).The average recovery of astilbin was 98.60%(RSD=2.49%).CONCLUSION This method is simple,accurate and reliable for the determination of astilbin contained in the leaf of Engelhardia roxburghiana Wall,and can be used for the quality control of Engelhardia roxburghiana Wall.

m09Fkygf.title: Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese prescription, and its active ingredient glycyrrhizin ameliorate experimental colitis through regulating cytokine balance.
m09Fkygf.abstract: Si-Ni-San, a traditional Chinese medicinal formula, exerts an important function in the treatment of inflammatory bowel diseases based upon thousands of years of clinical practice, but the underlying mechanism is still unclear. In this study, we investigated the therapeutic potential of Si-Ni-San and its ingredient glycyrrhizin in trinitrobenzene sulfonic acid (TNBS)-induced experimental colitis in mice, a well-characterized murine model for Crohn's disease. Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin significantly ameliorated TNBS-induced colitis with reduced mortality and recovery of body weights. In addition, Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin dose-dependently decreased macroscopic inflammation scores, microscopic histological scores, and myeloperoxidase activity. Furthermore, Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin caused a decrease in pro-inflammatory cytokines including IFN-gamma, IL-12, TNF-alpha and IL-17 and an increase in regulatory cytokine IL-10 in colon of the mice. It should be noticed the therapeutic effect of Si-Ni-San at 450 mg/kg was much better than that of its contained content of glycyrrhizin at 10 mg/kg. In conclusion, Si-Ni-San and glycyrrhizin significantly ameliorated TNBS-induced colitis in mice through regulating pro- and anti-inflammatory cytokine production.

N4TQpacr.title: Selective triggering of apoptosis of concanavalin A-activated T cells by fraxinellone for the treatment of T-cell-dependent hepatitis in mice.
N4TQpacr.abstract: Selectively inducing apoptosis of activated T cells is essential for the clearance of pathogenic injurious cells and subsequent efficient resolution of inflammation. However, few chemicals have been reported to trigger apoptosis of activated T cells in the treatment of hepatitis without affecting quiescent T cells. In the present study, we found that fraxinellone, a small natural compound isolated from the root bark of Dictamnus dasycarpus, selectively facilitated apoptosis of concanavalin A (Con A)-activated CD4(+) T cells rather than those non-activated, by disrupting the mitochondrial transmembrane potential, decreasing the ratio of Bcl-2/Bax, and increasing cytochrome c release from the mitochondria to the cytosol. The enhancement in Fas expression and caspase-8 activity, truncation of Bid, and down-regulation of anti-apoptotic cellular FLICE-inhibitory protein expression by fraxinellone also suggested the participation of an extrinsic apoptosis pathway. Furthermore, fraxinellone significantly alleviated Con A-induced T-cell-dependent hepatitis in mice, which was closely associated with reduced serum transaminases, pro-inflammatory cytokines, and pathologic parameters. Consistent with the in vitro results, fraxinellone dramatically induced apoptosis of activated peripheral CD4(+) T cells in vivo, consequently resulting in less CD4(+) T-cell activation and infiltration to the liver. These results strongly suggest fraxinellone might be a potential leading compound useful in treating T-cell-mediated liver disorders in humans.

VtMAndX0.title: Structural revision of two flavanonol glycosides from Smilax glabra.
VtMAndX0.abstract: The structures of two flavanonol glycosides isolated from Smilax glabra, named smitilbin and neosmitilbin, have been revised to isoastilbin and neoastilbin, respectively. The revised structures were determined based on intensive studies of chemical interconversion, NMR spectroscopy, and X-ray crystallographic analysis. The latest NMR data were also summarized.

s8jx2OwX.title: Effects of Relative Relationship on Growth and Survival of Juvenile Red Swamp Crayfish,Procambarus clarkii,Reared in a Laboratory
s8jx2OwX.abstract: The aim of this study was to investigate the importance of relative relationship in growth and survival of juvenile red swamp crayfish,Procambarus clarkii.The juveniles from 1,2,3 or 4 female crayfishes were reared together at a rate of 24 individuals per tank with triplication to determine the growth and survival of the juveniles.Relative relationship was clearly found to affect the growth of the crayfish.On the whole,the crayfish juveniles with more complex relatives had lower survival rate and higher disability rate,and coefficient of variation in body length,but higher growth rate in body length.

iA31e0AJ.title: Quantitative determination of astilbin in rabbit plasma by liquid chromatography.
iA31e0AJ.abstract: A simple method for determining the concentration of astilbin, a flavanone, in rabbit plasma has been developed. After liquid-liquid extraction, the flavanone was detected by HPLC on a 4.6-microm octadecylsilica column (Nova-Pak C-18) at 291 nm. Linear calibration graphs for astilbin were constructed from 0.44 to 22.17 microM. The limit of quantitation was 0.44 microM in plasma. The method has been applied to pharmacokinetic studies after a single i.v. and an oral administration of the compound to rabbits.

nxcDPGeg.title: Study on Nine Alkaloids from Corydalis Rhizoma with Quinone Reductase Inducing Activities
nxcDPGeg.abstract: OBJECTIVE To study the chemical constituents from Corydalis Rhizoma and their quinone reductase(QR) inducing activties in vitro.METHODS Chromatographic and spectroscopic methods were used to isolate and identify the alkaloids from the ethanol extraction of Corydalis Rhizoma.QR induction assay was employed to investigate the QR inducing activities of the isolated alkaloids.RESULTS Nine compounds were isolated and identified as d-corydaline(Ⅰ),dehydroglaucine(Ⅱ),tetrahydropalmatin(Ⅲ),protopine(Ⅳ),α-allocryptopine(Ⅴ),tetrahydrocolumbamine(Ⅵ),dehydrocorydaline(Ⅶ),berberine(Ⅷ),palmatine(Ⅸ).Among these alkaloids,d-corydaline(Ⅰ) and tetrahydrocolumbamine(Ⅵ) possessed moderate QR inducing activities in vitro.CONCLUSION The QR inducing activities of alkaloids from Corydalis Rhizoma were investigated for the first time,and the results generally show a positive significance.

CowmNotR.title: The differences of growth and living strategies between burrow and corner habitat in Procambarus clarkii
CowmNotR.abstract: Procambarus clarkii is a species of aggressive animal with burrowing and typical social behavior.The purpose of the experiment is to find out the differences of crayfish's growth between different habitats and presume the differences in their living strategies.In the experiment,we set up two types of sheltered living condition for P.clarkii in the ponds including burrows and corners,and the control group without any shelter.After one month,we calculated the survival rate,total weight gain,individual weight gain.Meanwhile,we obtained data of feeding and residual bait,and their sum and the growth increment in weight so as to calculate total feed consumption and feed convert ratio.The results indicated that survival rate of the burrow group ranks the highest(84.0%),then the corner group(63.0%),and then the control group(22.0%).Concerning the total weight gain,individual weight gain and feed convert ratio,the corner group ranks the first,with significantly higher total weight gain(324.2g),feed convert ratio(72.5%) than the other two groups,significantly higher individual weight gain(10.3g) than the burrow group.Total feed consumption of the control group is the lowest(248.2g) and significantly lower than the other two groups between which there is no significant difference. Our study indicated that the habitats of shelter have significant effects on the survival,foraging and growth of P.clarkii.Burrow has the biggest cover area which can provide protection to the greatest degree.Hiden in the burrows P.clarkii live in a relative conservative way,foraging and fighting little,which is good for survival.On the contrary,the cover area of corner is not as big as burrow,crayfish are fighting each other for shelter,their foraging and fighting behaviors are more obvious,their living strategies is relatively more adventurous,which is good for growth.

VDl4GZ9y.title: Antidiabetic activity of compounds of extracting from Anemarrhena asphodeloides
VDl4GZ9y.abstract: PurposeVarious chemical and chromatographic techniques were used to isolate and purify the antidiabetic active compounds extracted from Anemarrhena asphodeloides(AA).MethodsExperimental diabetes model was induced by alloxan or streptozotocin.The effects of compounds extracted from AA on diabetes animals were investigated by observing the change of fasting serum glucose index.Three components were indentified as sarsasapogeini,mangiferin,and neo-mangifrin from total polyphenol of AA.ResultsTotal polyphenol markedly decreased the level of fasting serum glucose of the diabetic animals induced by alloxan or streptozotocin.The mangiferin has the activity of the α-glucosidase inhititor in vitro.ConclusionTotal polyphenol of AA and the mangiferin can inhibit the activity of α-glucosidase,which is the possible mechanism of hypoglycemic effect on the diabetic animals.

etrMIqNU.title: Risk factor analysis of rheumatoid arthritis in a rural population
etrMIqNU.abstract: OBJECTIVE: To explore the risk factors of rheumatoid arthritis. METHODS: With the method of multi-stage cluster sampling, three townships from 37 townships of a city randomly selected at first, and rheumatoid arthritis (RA) was investigated for all the three township residents. All the RA cases were determined based on the county or above hospital diagnosis. After that, 144 cases from the 344 diagnosed patients were randomly selected as the case group and 191 healthy people, which have the similar gender and age constitute to the patient group was served as the control group. Twenty-three variables were investigated in this study, which mainly include gender, age, educational level, marital status, common cold, allergy to fish and shrimp, tonsillectomy, mumps history, occupation, labor intensity, trauma history, surgical history, blood transfusion history, housing type, humid living environment, keeping cats or dogs before adolescent, family history of RA or bronchial asthma or allergic rhinitis, oral contraceptives, body mass index (BMI), smoking, quit smoking, drinking, temperance, and drinking more tea and so on. RESULTS: Univariate analyses results showed that RA was significant statistically related to common cold, overweight and obesity, trauma history, family history of bronchial asthma or allergic rhinitis, family history of rheumatoid arthritis, drinking more tea, bungalow living and humid living environment. Then a multivariable unconditioned logistic regression analysis was adopt with the backward method, all the 18 variables mentioned in univariate analysis regarded as independent variables and the RA (yes or no) as the dependent variable. The results showed that RA was significant statistically associated with common cold, family history of bronchial asthma or allergic rhinitis, family history of rheumatoid arthritis, drinking more tea, bungalow living, humid living environment, overweight and obesity. CONCLUSION: The rheumatoid arthritis is primarily associated with common cold, family history of RA, living conditions and living habits in countryside population.

Q6vtOKsN.title: Study on risk factors and predictive model for lumbar intervertebral disc herniation in the rural population]
Q6vtOKsN.abstract: To explore the risk factors on the symptoms of lumbar intervertebral disc herniation so as to develop a predictive model for the disease.With a population-based case-control study, 303 of 50 123 residents were diagnosed as having lumbar intervertebral disc herniation symptoms. 152 cases and 167 healthy controls, matched by gender and age, were randomly chosen as case and control groups. Questionnaires were used to collect information on the exposure to risk factors and logistic predictive model was then established.Through non-conditional logistic regression analysis, data showed that the positive family history of lumbar vertebra disorder, lumbar treatment or surgery, mental stress, acute low back injury, permanent work pose, and body mass index >/= 23.0 kg/m(2) were the risk factors among residents from the countryside. The area under the receiver operator characteristic curve of logistic predictive model was 0.809. When 0.4 was set as the classification cutoff, the total predictive correct rate, sensitivity, and specificity were 74.0%, 73.7%, and 74.3% respectively.The occurrence of lumbar disk herniation can in countryside population was affected by multi-variables including genetic and environmental, and could be predicted with the logistic regression model established by our group. The positive predictive results could be used to alarm the patients and doctors for prevention and treatment of the disease.

khnyk0Pb.title: Clinical study of low-does thyroxin and betaloc in treatment of congestive heart failure and euthyroid sick syndrome
khnyk0Pb.abstract: [Objective] To investigate the clinical effect of low-close thyroxin and betaloc in the treatment of the congestive heart failure(CHF)and euthyroid sick syndrome(ESS),Who's heart function is in the level of Ⅲ,Ⅳ.[Methods] Forty-seven patients were randomly divided into two groups:treatment group and normal control group.Treatment group adds a lose-dose L-Thyroxin(20 mg/d)for 3 weeks.In the base of the normal treat in the heart failure,and add betaloc(12.5～37.5 mg/d)based on the patients heart rate.To control the patient's heart rate in the 60～80/min in the calm.Compared with pretreatments,after treatments,patients blood thyroxin,LVEF,LVDd,the peak of E/F and CO,and observe the new arrhythmia cordis and the angina pectoris.[Results] After 3 weeks,compared with normal control group,treatment group patients blood thyroxin,LVEF,LVDd,CO,E/F all improved obviously.Especially LVEF and CO.there was significantly different(P <0.05).But the affack of arrhythmia cordis and the angina pectoris had no difference(P >0.05).[Conclusion] Treatment with a lose-dose thyroxin and betaloc can improve CHF and ESS patients' heart function obviously,and also can control the happening of the arrhythmia cordis and the angina pectoris.

WqGmS6bL.title: Interaction between exposure to environmental smoke and the family history of chronic bronchitis (CB) on the risk of CB in rural females in Liuyang city, Hunan province]
WqGmS6bL.abstract: To explore the relationships and interaction among the exposure to environmental smoke, family history of chronic bronchitis (CB) and CB, in rural women.A population-based case-control study chi(2) was used to analyze the relationship between environmental smoke exposure, CB family history and CB. Additive effects model was used to analyze the interaction.In the first stage, 157 CB patients were screened from 24 268 women residents (prevalence rate is 6.47 per thousand), then 92 patients (case group) and 114 healthy women (control group) were investigated in the second stage. Results showed that: coal/firewood for heating (OR = 36.21) and CB family history (OR = 6.41) might serve as the risk factors of CB in rural women (P < 0.05). Factors as frequent cooking and using coal/firewood for heating had a positive interaction with family history of CB in rural women, CB with S as 5.39 and 9.02, attributable proportions of interaction (API) as 72% and 88%, relative excess risk of interaction (RERI) as 6.50 and 225.99, respectively.Using coal/firewood for heating and CB family history might be the risk factors of CB for rural women. A positive interaction between cooking frequently, heating model and CB family history was also seen.

xosrqbt9.title: The quality of life in hypertension population in rural area of Liuyang
xosrqbt9.abstract: [Objective]To evaluate the health-related quality of life(QOL) of patients with hypertension in Liuyang rural areas and analyze the main influential factors of QOL.[Methods]The Case-Control studies was carried out on the basis of chronic disease census in community population.[Results]268 cases(response rate:98.75%) and 235 controls were investigated(response rate:94.00%) in our study.The results showed that:patients with hypertension have lower scores than the controls in the general quality of life and eight dimensions of quality of life(P<0.05).The Elder people are,the worse quality of life they have in physical functioning(PF) and social functioning (SF)(P<0.05).The scores of all the dimensionalities of Men were higher than that of women(P<0.05);The more annual per capita income and better marriage people have,the better quality of life they have in PF(P<0.05);The more kinds of chronic diseases the patients have,the worse quality of life they have in PF,role-physical(RP),bodily pain(BP),general health(GH) and the general quality of life(P<0.05).The study does not show that education,career, annual per capita medical expenditure,the way of paying medical expenditure,smoking and drinking are associated with the quality of life of patients with chronic diseases(P>0.05).[Conclusion]The quality of life of hypertensive patients was worse than that of normal blood pressure.The determinants of the quality of life of patients with hypertension include age,sex,marriage,the annual per capita income and the kinds of chronic diseases.

RyhsjXHF.title: Risk factors of hypertension and its interaction in population in Liuyang, Hunan Province--a case-control study]
RyhsjXHF.abstract: To explore the risk factors of hypertension in a rural area in Hunan Province.A population-based case-control study was used. In the first step, three villages in Liuyang were selected by stratified cluster random sampling method and all local residents were investigated by face-to-face interview. Then some patients with hypertension found in the first step were randomly sampled to case group, while healthy adults with no hypertension and in similar compositions of gender and age with the case group were selected to control group. Independent effects of risk factors were analyzed by Logistic regression, and the interaction among risk factors was analyzed by using an additive effects model.Effective investigation data for 218 patients in the case group and 182 healthy people in the control group were used. The main risk factors of hypertension in rural areas of Liuyang, Hunan province were overweight (OR = 4.048), obesity (OR = 6.476), central obesity (OR = 2.632), and family history of hypertension (OR = 2.527). After adjusting some confounding factors, significant positive interaction were observed between family history, overweight/obesity and central obesity; the relative excess risk of interaction (RERI), attributable proportion of interaction (API), and the interaction index (S) were 3.268 vs 0.569, 48.365% vs 14.880%, and 2.313 vs 1.249, respectively.The cause of hypertension in rural areas of Liuyang, Hunan province was closely related with overweight, obesity, central obesity and family hypertension history. There were positive interactions between family history and overweight/obesity and central obesity in the causes of hypertension.

sylXCcen.title: Risk factors of stroke and their interactions in rural residents
sylXCcen.abstract: 【Objective】 To explore the risk factors of stroke and their interactions in rural residents.【Methods】 With the method of population-based case-control study,we randomly selected 232 cases and 232 controls.Using testing and Logistic regression to analyze the risk factors of stroke,and to analyze the interactions with additive effects model.【Results】 Long-time psychological repression,irregular menstruation and family history of stroke are the important risk factors of stroke,OR is 1.943,3.698 and 2.473,respectively.Long-time psychological repression and irregular menstruation have a positive interaction with family history of stroke,S is 1.656 and 6.034,API is 29.2% and 79.6%,RERI is 1.118 and 6.034,respectively.【Conclusion】 Long-time psychological repression,irregular menstruation and family history of stroke are the important risk factors of stroke,long-time psychological repression and irregular menstruation have an positive interaction with family history.

f0VB1prq.title: Effects of advanced glycosylation end products on the secretion function of monocyte in different dialysis-age patients
f0VB1prq.abstract: Aim: To investigate the effects of advanced glycosylation end products (AGE) on cytokines release from monocytes in patients of different haemodialysis age, and probe into the mechanism of AGE on microinflammation in chronic renal failure. Methods: 1 Totally 63 patients with chronic renal failure treated in the Department of Nephrology, Affiliated Hospital of Guangdong Medical College from December 2004 to February 2006 were selected, of whom, there were 16 patients with conservative therapy, and 47 haemodialysis patients, who were divided into short-term, medium-term and long-term dialysis groups according to dialysis time; 15 healthy examinees were selected as control. 2 5.0 -6.0 mL heparin-anticoagulated whole blood was harvested in the early morning or before dialysis. Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) were isolated and cultured for 24 hours after divided into 3 groups: AGE-BSA group, which was given 25 mg/L glycosylated bovine serum albumin (BSA); BSA group was given 25 mg/L BSA; control group without any intervention. 3 Twenty-four hours later, the supernatant was collected to measure the mass concentration of interleukin-1β (IL-1β) and tumor necrosis factor α (TNF-α) by ELISA method. Results: 1 Secretions of IL-1β in PBMCs: The spontaneously secretions of the control group and conservative therapy group were (10.08±0.77), (14.32±0.54) ng/L, and the short, medium and long term dialysis groups were higher than the conservative group [(78.55±7.89), (56.16±1.66), (37.03±1.78) ng/L, P < 0.05], and the secretion was decreased with dialysis time (P < 0.05); after BSA stimulation, IL-1β secretion of each group changed lightly compared with the control group (P > 0.05); after AGE-BSA stimulation, IL-1β secretion of each group was increased significantly compared with the control group (P < 0.01); the secretions of the short, medium and long term dialysis groups were lower than the conservative group [(132.09±23.66), (94.09±13.07), (68.14±10.56), (160.34±17.06) ng/L], and decreased with dialysis time (P < 0.05). 2 Secretions of TNF-α in PBMCs: The spontaneously secretions of the control group and conservative therapy group were (8.57±0.32), (10.89±0.68) ng/L, and the short, medium and long term dialysis groups were higher than the conservative group [(43.12±8.01), (30.78±5.34), (19.06±3.91) ng/L, P < 0.05], and the secretion was decreased with dialysis time (P < 0.05); after BSA stimulation, TNF-α secretion of each group changed lightly compared with the control group (P > 0.05); after AGE-BSA stimulation, TNF-α secretion of each group was increased significantly compared with the control group (P < 0.01); the secretions of the short, medium and long term dialysis groups were lower than the conservative group [(72.62±20.11), (51.08±14.78), (35.03±6.67), (103.14±9.05) ng/L], and decreased with dialysis time (P < 0.05). Conclusion: Microinflammation in patients with chronic renal failure is general. AGE takes part in the occurrence and development of microinflammation in chronic renal failure. Long-term haemodialysis could result in monocyte dysfunction, and worsen renal function failure.

igmKWghW.title: Multiuser MIMO downlink transmission strategy using independent component analysis
igmKWghW.abstract: We introduce a multiuser MIMO(MU-MIMO) downlink transmission strategy to solve the transmission problem for MIMO broadcast channels without available channel state information(CSI).By use of the scheme,base station(BS) selects a set of mobile stations(MS) and communicate simultaneously.Each transmit antenna at BS corresponds to an MS in the active user subset.The MS applies independent component analysis(ICA) algorithm to demix different components from the received mixing signals and identifies its own.Simulation results show that by applying the proposed strategy,MU-MIMO downlink transmission can be implemented successfully without CSI.

ESGih6g1.title: A New Scheme for Multiuser Dectection Complexity in DS-CDMA System
ESGih6g1.abstract: Multistage parallel interference cancellation is considered a simple and effective method for DS-CDMA system.It suffers from the unreliable cancellation and high computational complexity.This paper proposes a improved two-stage parallel interference cancellation scheme.Its computational complexity is lower.The simulation results show that it has a good performance.

97fR5Qx4.title: Joint resource management strategy for QoS guarantee in WiMAX downlink
97fR5Qx4.abstract: This paper proposed a novel joint resource management strategy in Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access(WiMAX) networks.According to channel,user and service traffic information,the system could dynamically adjust scheduling and resource allocation policy by the joint resource management in Base Station(BS) to implement adaptively bandwidth allocation in real-time channel.It could provide Quality of Service(QoS) guarantee to various multimedia communication services effectively.Simulation results show that this joint strategy can meet the requirement of QoS,such as rate,delay,etc,without sacrificing users' fairness.

YGzHD2Kp.title: Study of the cross-layer architecture for guarantee of QoS in WiMAX
YGzHD2Kp.abstract: This paper proposes one novel cross-layer architecture for quality of service (QoS) of guarantee in point-to-multipoint (PMP) Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access (WiMAX) networks, which divides the whole protocol structure model into two sub-planes vertically: one is data service flow delivery sub-plane which could provide data processing and delivering layer-by-layer for service flow based on IEEE 802.16 standards, and the other is the QoS resource management sub-plane which could coordinate the operation of all manage modules in different protocol layers and implement adaptive QoS joint control by various signaling. Simulation results show that the QoS joint control solution based on the cross-layer architecture can provide guarantee of QoS for multimedia communication service flow effectively and obtain users' fairness when comparing to the typical control solution used in PMP WiMAX.

1IfALTGL.title: Mode adaptive opportunistic transmission in MU-MIMO downlink with limited feedback
1IfALTGL.abstract: A mode adaptive opportunistic transmission scheme in multiuser multi-input multi-output (MU-MIMO) downlink with limited feedback is introduced. In each time slot only eligible mobile station (MS) whose channel quality exceeds a preset threshold would select transmission mode, including beamforming (BF) and spatial multiplexing (SM) and adaptively feed channel information. With feedback information, base station (BS) schedules one user out of candidate MS. Analysis is employed in evaluating the proposed scheme. Monte-Carlo simulation shows that the scheme can achieve high capacity as well as low outage probability with limited feedback cost.

PN7bs3KE.title: A novel power and bit adaptation algorithm for MIMO systems
PN7bs3KE.abstract: Aim In adaptive modulation system with transmit power constraint due to limited constellation the actual transmit power is always less than the given power.Spectral efficiency can be improved by utilizing this residual power.Methods The residual power adaptation was proposed in spatial domain as well as in space-time domain for adaptive MIMO systems.Results Simulation results indicate that using constant power allocation,then applying spatial-adaptation of residual power can improve spectral efficiency.Conclusion This algorithm is of low complexity and easy to implement.

WpYS0GUW.title: Distributed scheduling algorithm for multiuser MIMO downlink with adaptive feedback
WpYS0GUW.abstract: We propose a distributed scheduling algorithm for multiuser MIMO downlink with dynamic variation of transmission mode and feedback cost.With this algorithm each Mobile Station(MS) chooses transmission scheme,including beamforming and spatial multiplexing according to its channel state,then,feeds back the Channel State Information(CSI) to the Base Station(BS).Based on the received SCI,BS selects user subset to communicate with and implements precoding method to eliminate Co-Channel Interference(CCI).The user scheduling is carried out by MS and BS corporately.The cost of the system feedback depends on each MS's channel state.Compared with existing methods,the proposed algorithm can achieve higher system capacity and better Bit Error Rate(BER) performance with appropriate feedback load.

LGL80Ta6.title: Overview on Target Tracking Methods in Binary Wireless Sensor Networks
LGL80Ta6.abstract: Wireless sensor networks are one of new technologies in recent years and target tracking in the networks is one of the research emphases.The binary sensor networks are becoming more attractive due to the low cost deployment, small size,low energy consumption and simple operation and data communication of the sensors.Therefore,it is taken into consideration in target tracking.The methods availably used in target tracking of binary wireless sensor network can be cataloged into two classes,piecewise linear approximation based method and particle filter based method. The current research results were analytically presented,and the future work was also pointed out.

JiZU9BK5.title: Research on Power and Bit Adaptation Algorithm for MIMO Systems
JiZU9BK5.abstract: In adaptive modulation system with transmit power constraint due to limited constellation the actual transmit power is always less than the given power.Spectral efficiency can be improved by utilizing this residual power.This paper investigated power and bit adaptation in MIMO systems and proposed an adaptation algorithm with spatial-domain residual power reallocation.Simulation results show that applying equal power allocation and then reallocation residual power in spatial domain can improve spectral efficiency.This is of low complexity and easy to implement.

tNMgxttc.title: A Fair-Oriented Two-Level Scheduling Scheme for QoS Guarantee in WiMAX
tNMgxttc.abstract: As the standard of worldwide interoperability for microwave access(WiMAX) technology,IEEE 802.16 defined five classes of traffic services,which are UGS,rtPS,ertPS,nrtPS,and BE,respectively,and introduced a supporting mechanism for quality of services(QoS) into medium access control(MAC) layer.But it did not propose the corresponding scheduling algorithm.In order to provide various multimedia communications with QoS guarantee effectively,a two-level scheduling scheme is proposed based on the orthogonal frequency division multiple access(OFDMA) technology and adaptive modulation and coding(AMC) mechanism.This scheduling scheme employes the cross-layer design methodology and can be used in the point-to-multipoint(PMP) WiMAX downlink.According to the value of QoS priority,the first-level scheduler schedules the head of line(HOL) packets in different service class buffers to satisfy the rtPS maximum delay restriction and nrtPS minimum rate requirement simultaneously.After accomplishing the first-level scheduling,the second-level scheduler schedules the HOL packets in different user buffers according to the AMC information and users' state message for obtaining the users' rate fairness.Simulation results show that the proposed two-level scheme can meet various QoS requirements of multimedia services well without sacrificing users' rate fairness,and meanwhile,get the preferable WiMAX system throughput.

jndgNsBd.title: Experimental study on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease treated by medical instrument on hepatic diseases of type I DSG in rats
jndgNsBd.abstract: AIM: To investigate the primary therapeutic efficacy of the medical instrument on hepatic diseases of type I DSG in treating nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) of rats. METHODS: Fifty male SD rats were randomly divided into 5 groups. The control groups (n = 20, N1 and N2 group) were fed with normal diet, and the model groups (n = 30, M1, M2 and T group) were fed with fat-rich diet consisting of 0.88 standard normal diet + 0.10 lard oil + 0.02 cholesterol. Therapeutic group (T group) was treated from wk 13 and finished at wk 20. The levels of serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), gamma-glutamyl-transpeptidase (GGT), alkaline phosphatase (ALP), total protein (TP), triglycerides (TG), total cholesterol (TC), low-density lipoprotein (LDL), and high density lipoprotein (HDL) were measured. The hepatic histologic changes were observed with HE and Masson staining. RESULTS: At the end of the experiment, compared with those in the normal control groups, the liver index (t = 8.65, P < 0.01) and serum ALT (t = 4.65, P < 0.01), AST (t = 4.74, P < 0.01), ALP (t = 3.56, P < 0.01), TP (t = 6.35, P < 0.01), TC (t = 8.41, P < 0.01), and LDL (t = 8.86, P < 0.01) levels were increased significantly in the model control groups, and the hepatic steatosis (Z = -4.135, P < 0.01), inflammation (Z = -3.752, P < 0.01) and fibrosis (Z = -4.156, P < 0.01) were more serious. Compared with those in the model control groups, the serum ALT, GGT, ALP, TP, TG, and TC levels were all down-regulated in the therapeutic group without significances, while AST (t = -2.404, P < 0.05) level was reduced significantly. The degrees of hepatic steatosis and inflammation were decreased without statistical significances, but fibrosis degrees were lightened markedly (Z = -3.101, P < 0.01). CONCLUSION: The medical instrument on hepatic diseases of type I DSG has some therapeutic effect in treating NAFLD of rats.
keywords: Medical instrument on hepatic diseases of type I DSG

yJp0sdhr.title: In vitro effects of a novel nucleoside analog beta-LPA against hepatitis B virus
yJp0sdhr.abstract: AIM: To explore the in vitro effects of a novel nucleoside analog (β-LPA) against hepatitis B virus (HBV). METHODS: HepG2.2.2.15 cells were cultured and treated with various concentrations of β-LPA. Serum HBsAg and HBeAg were deter- mined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Intracelluar DNA was extracted and subjected to Southern blotting, hybridized with 32P-labeled HBV probe and autoradiographed. The intensity of the autoradiographic bands was quantified by densitometric scans of computer and ED50 value was calculated. Cytotoxicity with different concentrations of drugs was examinedby methyl thiazolyl tetrazolium (MTT) method and ID50 value was calculated. RESULTS: Autoradiographic bands showed that β-LPA inhibited the replication of HBV DNA in a dose-dependent manner. ED50 value was 0.01 μmol/L. Cytotoxicity experiment showed that the ID50 value of β-LPA was 50 μmol/L. The con- tents of HBsAg and HBeAg were decreased in a concentration-dependent manner. β-LPA at a low concentration had no marked effect on HBsAg and HBeAg in supernate. CONCLUSION: β-LPA possesses potent inhibi- tory effect on the replication of HBV in vitro with little cytotoxicity.

1eQZXBva.title: Effects of total flavones of Hippophae rhamnoides L.on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in rats
1eQZXBva.abstract: Objective To investigate the primary therapeutic role of total flavones of Hippophae rhamnoides L (TFH)in treating nonalcoholic fatty liver disease(NAFLD)of rats.Methods Fifty-four male SD rats were randomly di- vided into 5 groups.The normal control groups (n=20,N1 and N2 group)were fed with normal diet;NAFLD model groups (n=22,M1 and M2 group)and therapeutic group(n=12,T group)were fed with fat-rich diet,which was consis- ted with 10% lard oil and 2% cholesterol.Therapeutic group was treated with TFH at the dose of 10 mg/d from the 13~(th) week and finished at the 20~(th) week.The serum ALT,AST,GGT,ALP,TP,TG,TC,LDL,HDL,MOD levels and SOD activity were measured.And the degrees of hepatic histologic change were observed with HE and Masson stains. Results At the end of the experiment,compared with the normal control group,the liver index and the serum ALT、AST、ALP、TP、TC、LDL levels were increased significantly(P≤0.01)in NAFLD model control group,and the hepatic steatosis,inflammation and fibrosis were more serious(P≤0.01).Compared with NAFLD model control group,the ser- um ALT,GGT,ALP,AST,TG,and TC levels were all down-regulated in the therapeutic group and ALT,AST,and TC level were decreased significantly(P≤0.05);The degrees of the hepatic steatosis and inflammation were improved with- out statistical significance while fibrosis degrees were lightened markedly(P≤0.01);The serum MOD was significantly decreased(P≤0.05) and the SOD activity in serum was up-regulated but with no statistical significance.Conclusion TFH has some therapeutic role in treating NAFLD of rats.
keywords: Total flavones of Hippophae rhamnoides L.

sMDhqb36.title: Heparanase: a new universal metastasis-associated antigen in the immunotherapy for the advanced cancers
sMDhqb36.abstract: Heparanase (Hpa) was an endo-β-D-glucuronidase that can cleave heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs) and has been implicated in tumor angiogenesis and metastasis. It has been reported that Hpa was expressed in almost all the advanced tumors, especially in metastatic tumors, and in contrast, down-regulation of Hpa could inhibit the metastasis of tumors. These results indicated that Hpa could serve as a new universal tumor-metastasis-associated antigen in the immunotherapy for the advanced tumors. Development of Hpa vaccine may establish a new method for the treatment of the advanced tumors. In this review, structure and functions of Hpa and its possibility as a new universal antigen in the immunotherapy of the advanced tumors were discussed.
